text: The living materials of the cell consist of

A pupil accidentally "watered" a potted plant with concentrated salt solution after sometime the plant began to wilt.
The wilting of the plant is due to the fact that

options.A: the root hair die off and can no longer absorb water
options.B: the salt solution causes faster rate of transpiration leading to the death of the plant cell
options.C: the salt solution has caused water lost from the plant cell leading to loss of turgor
options.D: the plant tissue has been poisoned by the salt which is absorbed by the plant

text:
A pupil accidentally "watered" a potted plant with a concentrated salt solution. After sometime the plant began to wilt.
Which of the following activities would revive the plant?

options.A: Covering the plant with dark paper to prevent further water loss from its surfaces
options.B: Leaving the plant to adapt to the condition
options.C: Exposing the plant to higher concentration of oxygen
options.D: Adding more water to the soil

explanation: If a plant is dehydrated, it can wilt and become unable to perform vital functions such as photosynthesis. To revive the plant, it is important to add more water to the soil as it will replenish the water supply for the plant, allowing it to recover and continue performing its functions.

text: Which of the following parts of the skeleton does not have a protective function?
Carbon dioxide is carried in the plasma?
explanation: Carbon dioxidecan betransportedthrough the blood via three methods. It is dissolved directly in the blood, bound toplasmaproteins or hemoglobin, or converted into bicarbonate.

text: In the adult frog gaseous exchange takes place in the
explanation: The frog uses the buccal cavity (mouth-throat) to pump air into the lungs. The floor of the mouth is lowered, drawing air in through the nostrils, and then raised, forcing air into the lungs. Frogs can also breathe through their skin, which is thin and moist, allowing for efficient gas exchange.

The part of the young root that pushes its way through the soil is the
explanation:
The part of a young root that pushes through the soil is the root cap, a protective layer of cells at the tip of the root.
The root cap acts as a "hard hat" or protective shield, allowing the root to penetrate the soil without being damaged by friction or sharp particles.

text: The speed of the flow of water in a river is faster in the middle than along the banks due to

options.A: differences to turbidity at different parts of the river
options.B: the abundance of fishes and other organisms along the bank
options.C: reduced force of gravity in the middle portion of the river
options.D: resistance offered by the wall of the banks.

text: The effects of environmental degradation caused by human activities can be controlled by the following measures except

options.B: converting mining pits into fish ponds

explanation:
While resettling indigenous inhabitants might be a consequence of environmental degradation or development projects, it doesn't directly control or mitigate the effects of environmental degradation.
Reclaiming the land by restoring degraded lands can help revive ecosystems, Converting mining pits into fish ponds, can be a form of rehabilitation, making use of existing excavations, and educating people can also help in raising awareness and promoting sustainable practices which can significantly reduce environmental degradation.
Consequently, option C is the correct answer.
Education, land reclamation, and innovative reuse of areas like mining pits can all contribute to controlling environmental damage.

text: The order of evolution trend in plants is
explanation: Spermatophyta are seed-bearing plants that have evolved further to produce seeds as a means of reproduction. They include gymnosperms and angiosperms. Therefore, the correct order of evolution trend in plants isThallophyta, Bryophyta, Pteridophyta, and Spermatophyta.
